definition: Harper (name)/see also 斯蒂芬·哈珀[Si1 di4 fen1 · Ha1 po4]
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
see 斯蒂芬·哈珀[Si1 di4 fen1 · Ha1 po4]
Stephen Harper (1959-), Canadian politician, prime minister from 2006

sentences.english: Harper wasn’t interested in going back to prison, and so he killed himself with a bullet to the chest.
sentences.chinese: 哈珀不想再回到監獄，所以他擊穿自己的胸膛自殺了。
心口不一啊，汝的名字是哈珀。

sentences.english: Mr. Harper bought out a nearby hardware store.
sentences.chinese: 哈珀先生盤進附近一家五金店的全部貨底。

sentences.english: Thomas Harper, a Jacksonville -based labor attorney who writes a newsletter on Florida employment law.
sentences.chinese: 哈珀曾爲佛羅里達州勞工法撰寫過通訊。

sentences.english: HarperCollins plans an initial print run of 1.5m copies.
sentences.chinese: 哈珀柯林斯計劃在首次付印時印刷150萬冊。

definition: Beckenham or Beckham (name)/David Beckham (1975-), British midfield footballer
Brooklyn, borough of New York City
"Becks", nickname of British footballer David Beckham (see 貝克漢姆|贝克汉姆[Bei4 ke4 han4 mu3])
Wylie (name)/Turrell Wylie, originator of the Wylie transcription of Tibetan script
